com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.edfexamples.common

Class EDFChannelSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.common.ChannelSession
      • com.thomsonreuters.upa.examples.edfexamples.common.EDFChannelSession

  • public class EDFChannelSession
extends ChannelSession
    Manages UPA EDF channel and provides methods for connection establishment, channel initialization, read, and write methods for EDF consumer example.

    Usage of this class within the EDF Consumer application:
    1. Call initTransport(boolean, Error) to initialize UPA
    2. Call connect(InProgInfo, Error).
    3. Call initChannel(InProgInfo, Error) for TCP connections in loop until channel becomes active that is channel state is ChannelState.ACTIVE.
    4. When channel state is ChannelState.ACTIVE for TCP connections, send Login Request.
    5. Read and process responses.

    This class is used in the EDF Consumer main method also to store a list of all other EDFChannelSessions used. This list is stored so that all of these EDFChannelSessions can be added to one Selector used only by the EDF Consumer to read from all channels.

    This class also detects connection failures in TCP and provides a query method for the application to retry connection establishment.

    This class is a wrapper utility class for UPA's Channel and Transport classes and handles typical return codes from UPA, for example, file descriptor changes during read, connection failures, registering for write when there is more data in the queue, flushing of data after write, flush failures.

    See Also:
    Transport.initialize(InitArgs, Error), Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error), Channel.init(InProgInfo, Error), Channel.read(ReadArgs, Error), Channel.write(TransportBuffer, WriteArgs, Error)

      • selectTime

        public boolean selectTime(long selectTime)
        Allows the user to specify a select timeout. The default select timeout will be one third of the channel's negotiated ping time out. Providers will use this method to control their content update time.
        Overrides:
        selectTime in class ChannelSession
        Parameters:
        selectTime - a value greater than zero.
        Returns:
        true if the selectTime was greater than zero.

      • connect

        public int connect(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.InProgInfo inProg,
                   com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Establishes the outbound connection to the UPA server. If connection is established, registers the channelInfo.channel for read and write select operation. It recovers connection in case of connection failure. It assumes application has called initTransport(boolean, Error) before calling this method.

        Typical usage is for establishing connection is:
        1. Call connect(InProgInfo, Error).
        2. Call initChannel(InProgInfo, Error) in loop until channelInfo.channel becomes active, ChannelState.ACTIVE

        Overrides:
        connect in class ChannelSession
        Parameters:
        inProg - - InProgInfo
        error - - UPA error information in case of connection failure.
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes
        See Also:
        Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error)
